title: Leaves from the journal of our life in the Highlands, from 1848 to 1861 :
author: Victoria
snippet: The Duke rode with us all theway as Lord Lieutenant of the county, untilwe arrived at Dalmeny, where Lord Hopetounmet us and rode with us. At eleven we reachedthe South Queensferry, where we got out ofour carriage and embarked in a little steamer ;the ladies and gentlemen and our carriages goingin another. We went a little way up the Forth,to see Hopetoun House, Lord Hopetoun's, whichis beautifully situated between Hopetoun and Dalmeny.

title: Journal of a lady of quality;
author: Schaw, Janet
snippet: * Queensferry is a small seaport on the Firth of Forth, eight miles west of Edinburgh. South Queensferry is in Linlithgowshire and North Queensferry  in Fifeshire. A ferry at that time and until 1890 connected the two places.

title: Leaves from the journal of our life in the Highlands, from 1848 to 1861.

title: Provost-Marshal: a romance of the middle shires
author: Moncreiff, Frederick Charles
snippet: For aspace he gazed moodily out upon the water; he sawthe ships going backwards and forwards, and in thosedays there were many, for the trade was brisk withAntwerp, Bordeaux, Lisbon, and many other foreignports. He saw the richly wooded banks on the farside of the water, and the smoke rising from the littletown of South Queensferry opposite to him. Henoted all the islands laid out as on a map below, and

title: Reminiscences of childhood at Inverkeithing;
author: Simson, James
snippet: tain of the okl rickety steam ferryboat  told me to "jump aboard," when I made a trip to the South Queensferry,  which was an important event in my experience there.

title: The Ossians
author: Johnstone, Doug
snippet: The Hawes Inn knew how to make money from the past. A chalkboard outside the whitewashed South Queensferry pub declared 'Inn Keeping with Tradition, established 1638'. They were offering a set-price lunch called Robert Louis Stevenson's Choice.

title: Provost-Marshal: a romance of the middle shires
author: Moncreiff, Frederick Charles
snippet: He was no longer in doubt. So theypassed out of Fife in a ship which brought themquickly to the South Queensferry. And the boysaid to himself, " Surely this medicinar, for all hisgrave airs, is a great ass."
